questions.question: According to the introduction, what is the primary responsibility of the Jamaica Constabulary Force (JCF) regarding persons taken into custody?

options.a: To ensure they are treated with severity and discipline.
options.b: To ensure their human rights are upheld and they are treated respectfully and dignified.
options.c: To extract information from them through interrogation.
options.d: To transfer them to correctional facilities immediately.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to the first paragraph of the Introduction.

questions.question: What is the significance of the 2014 revised Lock-up Administration policy and procedures mentioned in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.a: It introduced new harsher measures for detainees.
options.b: It consolidated various directives and established international standards for interrogation.
options.c: It reduced the responsibilities of the JCF regarding detainees.
options.d: It focused on reducing the number of lock-up facilities.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to the first paragraph of the Introduction.

questions.question: According to the Lock-up Administration Policy, who is responsible for the safety and effective management of all prisoners while in police custody?

options.c: All members of the JCF and its auxiliary.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to the first paragraph of the Introduction.

questions.question: What is the consequence for breaches of the Lock-ups Administration Policy and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)?

options.c: A fine for the responsible officers.
options.d: Handling through the JCF disciplinary process.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (d). Traced back to the first paragraph of the Introduction.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the Lock-up Administration Policy and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) mentioned in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.b: To protect the rights of detainees.
options.c: To reduce the number of police lock-ups.
options.d: To promote secrecy in detention procedures.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to the second paragraph of the Introduction.

questions.question: According to the Lock-up Administration Policy, who does the Lock-up Administration Policy and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) apply to?

options.a: Only sworn members of the JCF.
options.b: Only unsworn members of the JCF.
options.c: All members of the JCF and Rural Police.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). Traced back to the third paragraph under 'Scope.'

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Lay Visitors' as mentioned in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.b: To conduct regular inspections of lock-up facilities.
options.c: To serve as legal representatives for detainees.
options.d: To assist in the transport of detainees.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to the definition of 'Lay Visitors' in section 5.3.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Gaol Delivery' as mentioned in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.b: To record the status of prisoners during a court session.
options.d: To transport prisoners to correctional facilities.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to the definition of 'Gaol Delivery' in section 5.2.

questions.question: Who is responsible for coordinating all matters relating to police lock-ups and conducting regular visits and inspections, as mentioned in the Lock-up Administration Policy?

options.c: The Deputy Commissioner of Police i/c Administration.

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). Traced back to section 6.5.

questions.question: According to the Lock-up Administration Policy, what is the recognized purpose of Lock-ups?
questions.notes: The correct answer is (a). Traced back to policy statement 7.3.
